content.description: beta pending
content.location: See picture.

content.description: Fun slopey moves, sustained and with nice exposure and river views.
content.protection: toprope anchors in the trees.  A 50' piece of webbing can be slung around at least 2 trees.
content.location: Climbs the bulge at the south edge of the stone platform.

content.description: beta pending
content.location: See picture.

content.description: Climb the right side of Blank Wall (near First Crack) using good ledges and small pockets to get to a large bucket. Continue to the small roof and climb directly over on decent holds to the top.
content.location: Right side of Blank Wall (left of First Crack).

content.description: This has a face start to a dihedral crack to a medium chimney towards the top. the crux is about 15 feet up when moving from the face to the dihedral.
content.location: In the northeast corner of the quadrangle. This is the prominent dihedral.

content.description: This route follows the large dihedral to the left of Monkey Swing. Starting at the base of the cave, climb the left face until a stem is possible. Continue to the cedar and on up the face to the top.
content.location: Spinal Compression and Monkey Swing are found ont eh wall just to the north of the Quadrangle. They can be reached by an easy trail 30 feet north of the Sentinel access. They are on an open West-facing wall with a large roof that forms a cave-like recess at the wall's base.

content.description: Climb the face between Pretzel and Nosey. This intricate and technical climb features small face holds, a pinch hold in a pocket, a layback off the corner, an awkward undercling, and lots of interesting (hard) moves.
content.location: Between the Pretzel and Nosey.

content.description: Sustained 5.8 face climbing.  A fun route, definitely worth doing.
content.protection: Solo the east face of Sentinel to set up anchor on the bolts/chain.
content.location: First face on the approach to the cove, on the right after the boulder scramble.  Longer than most routes here.

content.description: The easy laidback east face of Sentinel Tower.  Massive jugs and ladder-like climbing.  Crux is probably the top-out move.
content.protection: Chicken necks can be slung in a couple spots, or use large active pro in the pockets.  Bolts on top for anchor.
content.location: The large laid back face to the right of the big chimney crack.  For a good alternate, scramble through the chimney to the ledge facing the river.

content.description: Climb the chimney from the Cove (East) side of the Sentinel. Escape right to the north face near top and avoid the block on the South tower of the sentinel.
content.protection: TR from bolts on the Sentinel North tower, or solo. There may be placements for Big Bros in the chimney or smaller side gear on the East face.
content.location: Separating the two towers of the Sentinel.

content.description: Climb the wide crack and face on the left.
content.location: It's the second crack. Left of Blank Wall.

content.description: Nose/arête around the corner from Double Overhang.  Follow the nose all the way up, but watch the spiders.  Crux is about a quarter of the way up, where handholds get marginal so you have to just hug the arête and high-step it.  The exposure and views are pretty amazing, and it's also a wonderful photo opportunity...
content.protection: Bolted anchors and lots of solid trees at the top for TR.
content.location: Sentinel area.  Obvious nose around the corner from double overhang.  Start in the corridor access area.

content.description: Two bulges after the midway point mark the crux - the second harder only because you'll be more pumped when you get to it.
content.protection: Anchor the cedars at the top.  Bring at least 50' of webbing.  The climbers approach to the top of the cliff is found down near the regular people's trail, before you do the class 4 moves into the cove.
content.location: Off the edge of the cove to the far right.  Down climb to the belay or employ Aaron Stover's super swing method, which may well put a nearby tree branch up your heinny if you don't dial it just right.

content.description: Starting from the Southeast corner of the Quadrangle, traverse within 3 feet of the ground all the way to Third Crack.
content.protection: Crash pads? (This is a low traverse.)
content.location: Main wall of the quadrangle, from First Crack to Third Crack.

content.description: First, escalate up the ladder of tree roots just left of the access to Forgotten Wall. Climbt he chimney and follow either of the 2 parallel vertical cracks leaving the chimney, avoiding the bush as much as possible. Angle slightly right, and continue to the top.
content.location: See topo and description.

content.description: Sustained climb, starts same as Pretzel and angles left at the split in the crack (where Pretzel angles right).
content.location: In the middle of the face between Third Crack and Nosey (at the Cove/Sentinel area).

content.description: The crux is the namesake of this route.  A hard reach right to an undercling and slick foot smearing.
content.location: Second wall on left (after the cave), follows obvious central line.

content.description: A moderately laid back arete and face route.  Crux is early.
content.protection: Anchors the same trees as Pretzel.
content.location: Around the corner to the right of Pretzel.  Climbs the face and arete.

content.description: Climb starts just left of Blank Wall,climb up small pockets with out holds from Second Crack and Blank Wall.Work up to thin crack (dont barn door)Pull small roof at top .
The largest crack on the river face of the Sentinel. Filled with mud and chockstones. The only reason to thrash up the 15 feet of this mess is to get to the fine hand crack in the solid rock above.
content.location: See picture.

content.description: Stand on a large block to readh the lip of the roof. Hand traverse right and swing a foot into the vertical crack. muscle up and layback into a seat on the small leadge just above the roof, and continue up and left through fragile flakes to a dihedral on the right edge of another roof.
content.location: Spinal Compression and Monkey Swing are found ont eh wall just to the north of the Quadrangle. They can be reached by an easy trail 30 feet north of the Sentinel access. They are on an open West-facing wall with a large roof that forms a cave-like recess at the wall's base.

content.description: the route takes a little balance,and the crux is just under the the small nose overhang
content.protection: takes about 15 feet of webbing,same tie up as Up n Off
content.location: The climb is in the Sentinal Area the climb starts just around the corner of Up n Off

content.description: Start on the face left of the Pretzel. Use tiny face holds to climb 15 feet to a horizontal crack. Continue up, staying left of Pretzel Face and six feet right of Third Crack.
content.location: Between Pretzel and Pretzel Face.

content.description: Crack and dihedral system to the right of Blank Wall.
content.protection: Toprope or scant pro. Has dedicated anchor chain which can be reached by traversing right from the Nosey anchor ledge. There are a few bolts available to protect the traverse.
content.location: First crack is in the southeast corner of the Quadrangle.

content.description: starts just left of third crack under an over hang- ends up and to the left by 4th crack
content.location: Sentinel area between 4th and 3rd crack

content.description: Bouldery overhang start to easier moves.
content.protection: Two or three larger cams should do it if you feel good running out, or hike to/approach from the top and drop a toprope from the three bolts surrounding the tree. Plenty of webbing needed for the anchor.
content.location: First route on left face as you enter the cove.

content.description: beta pending
content.location: See picture.

content.description: Large Chimney all the way up.  Classic ROute in MP.
content.protection: No Bolts, Top Rope from natural anchors.
content.location: Last large crack before the southern access point to the top.

content.description: Follow the thin crack right of Dimitri's Demise with face moves past an old pin and through a bulge. Take a rest at the big detached block and continue up and slightly left using thin cracks and pockets.
content.location: See picture.

content.description: The key to this route is the small finger crack located just to the left of Underexposed. Start in Usderexposed crack and traverse left six feet until under the finger crack. Use a layback on a small knowb and poor footholds to reach the crack.
content.location: West face of Sentinel. (See topo.)

content.description: Little pockets are the trick on this one.  Big first move with smears up to mono and 2-finger pockets. Sustained for the first two thirds, then it mellows out a little.
content.location: Up the middle of the face between the cracks at the east end of the cove.  Starts on a juggy 2-hand pocket about seven feet up.

content.description: The exact location of these routes is unknown. Please help mountain project determine their location.
